docblock.description: Saves the hourly API key usage count.

tag.name: return
tag.description: API hourly usage count.

docblock.description: Gets the response code from the response.
Get domain used for displaying IDX pages.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Array containing domain 'scheme' & 'url'.

docblock.description: Get a list of all agents for your clients.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Query args to send in to API call.

tag.name: return
tag.description: All available agents.

docblock.description: Get a list of featured MLS properties.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Query args to send in to API call.

tag.name: return
tag.description: List of featured MLS properties for each client.

docblock.description: Get a list of all leads.
docblock.long-description: For bandwidth and memory considerations there is a limit of 5,000 on the number of leads that can be returned in any single request. Even if a full week of data is requested this limit will only be encountered if your clients have a combined average 30+ leads created, updated, or active per hour (as such it will be most common when requesting leads based on last property update date). If this limit is exceeded a 413 -Requested Entity Too Large error is returned. If encountered a smaller interval will need to be used.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Query args to send in to API call.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The applicable client account ID, lead ID, first name, last name, email address, address, city, state/province, country, zipCode, phone number, ID of the agent assigned, email format (html or plain text), disabled status (y/n), allowed to log in to their account (y/n), will receive property updates (y/n), subscribe date, last edited, last login date, last property update date, last activity type, and last activity date.

docblock.description: Get a list of all leads traffic history.
docblock.long-description: Note: For bandwidth and memory considerations there is a limit of 5,000 on the number of searches that can be returned in any single request.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Query args to send in to API call.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The applicable client account ID, date, lead ID, IP , page, and referrer.

docblock.description: This method gives the status for all MLS listings (not supplemental) broken down by client account ID. This includes sold/pending listings with an unknown status which are not usually returned by sold/pending api methods.
docblock.long-description: This is helpful if you need to know when previously gathered featured properties have left the market.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Query args to send in to API call.

tag.name: return
tag.description: MLS listings along with their statuses.

docblock.description: Get a list of all lead saved properties.
docblock.long-description: For bandwidth and memory considerations there is a limit of 5,000 on the number of searches that can be returned in any single request.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Query args to send in to API call.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Search ID, the applicable client account ID, lead ID, page ID, search name, search parameters, lead will receive property updates (y/n), created date, last edited date.

docblock.description: Get a list of all lead saved searches.
docblock.long-description: For bandwidth and memory considerations there is a limit of 5,000 on the number of searches that can be returned in any single request.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Query args to send in to API call.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Search ID, the applicable client account ID, lead ID, page ID, search name, search parameters, lead will receive property updates (y/n), created date, last edited date.

docblock.description: Get a list of sold/pending MLS properties.
docblock.long-description:
Output fields may or may not be populated depending on how the information was entered into the IDX system.
We are planning to add the ability to query by the date the property left the market and, for sold listings, the date it was sold in a future update.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Query args to send in to API call.

tag.name: return
tag.description: List of soldpending properties for each client.

docblock.description: Get a list of supplemental (non-MLS) properties.
docblock.long-description: Output fields may or may not be populated depending on how the information was entered into the IDX system.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Query args to send in to API call.

tag.name: return
tag.description: List of supplemental (non-MLS) properties for each client.

docblock.description: Get the default api version.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The default api version.

docblock.description: List of available MLSs with their fees.

tag.name: return
tag.description: List of available MLSs with their fees.

docblock.description: A list of clients available to a given partner. The list of clients can be filtered by GET values.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Query args to send in to API call.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The account ID, company name, display name, account status, and current API key of each client or clients matching the filter values.

docblock.description: This is a simple, access anywhere, method for getting a list of all API components available.

tag.name: return
tag.description: All available APIs/Components.

docblock.description: A simple method for listing all available methods in the current API component. This method will also list which request methods (GET, PUT, POST, or DELETE) are supported by each method in addition to each method status.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Basic information about all available methods in this API.

docblock.description: Gives the names and IDs of all available property types. This method differs from the property type lookup method in the client API component in that it can look up property types for any active Platinum MLS, not just those for which the client is a member.
docblock.long-description:
Note: The IDX property types are those used for multiple MLS searches and are equivalent to the property types used in the original IDX product. The data returned is structured as:
idxPropTypes * parentPtID - the numeric ID for IDX property types; seen as parentPtID when retrieving property information. * pt - the 2 to 3 letter abbreviated property type as seen in multiple MLS search queries as the variable pt. * propertyType - the human friendly property type name. [idxID] in the format a### (this element will not be present at all if no IDX ID is provided) * mlsPtID - the numeric ID given to MLS property types; seen as parentPtID when retrieving property information and in single MLS search queries as the variable pt. * propertyType - the human friendly property type name. * parentPtID - the ID of the IDX property type to which this MLS property type belongs.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The IDX ID of the MLS from which you need property type information. If no IDX ID is specified then only the IDX property types (parentPtID) will be returned.

tag.name: param
tag.description: A string or an array of strings of return field names.

tag.name: return
tag.description: An array containing the IDX property types and, if an IDX ID has been provided, the MLS's property types and their IDs.

docblock.description: Get your account type.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Account type.

docblock.description: View agent information on a multi-user account.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Query args to send in to API call.

tag.name: return
tag.description: All agents on the account or those matching filter values.

docblock.description: Get the default api version.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The default api version.

docblock.description: Returns the cities available in each of a client's city lists. Since a client can build any number of city lists this method requires the ID of which list you want to view. To get a list of all city lists available do not send the primary request ID. The default list on each account has the id combinedActiveMLS

tag.name: param
tag.description: City list id.

tag.name: param
tag.description: A string or an array of strings of return field names.

tag.name: return
tag.description: All cities in a given list or, if no list ID is provided, a list of list IDs.

docblock.description: Returns the IDs and names for each of a client's city lists including MLS city lists. To get the list of all city lists available do not send the primary request ID. The default list on each account has the ID combinedActiveMLS

tag.name: return
tag.description: A list of city list IDs and names.

docblock.description: Returns the counties available in each of a client's county lists. Since a client can build any number of county lists this method requires the ID of which list you want to view. To get a list of all county lists available do not send the primary request ID. The default list on each account has the id combinedActiveMLS.

tag.name: param
tag.description: If no ID is given a list of IDs is returned.

tag.name: param
tag.description: A string or an array of strings of fields to return in the output..

tag.name: return
tag.description: All counties in a given list or, if no list ID is provided, a list of list IDs.

docblock.description: Returns the IDs and names for each of a client's counties lists including MLS counties lists. To get the list of all counties lists available do not send the primary request ID. The default list on each account has the ID combinedActiveMLS

tag.name: return
tag.description: A list of counties list IDs and names

docblock.description: Update dynamic wrapper url for global, pages and saved links. If savedLinkID, or pageID are not passed, the global dynamic wrapper url will be updated.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Dynamic wrapper url.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Saved link ID if setting dynamic wrapper url for a specific saved link.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Page ID if setting dynamic wrapper url for a specific page.

tag.name: return
tag.description: No data returned on success.

docblock.description: Returns a basic set of information for all of the client's featured (active) properties

tag.name: param
tag.description: Query args to send in to API call.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Featured properties on the account.

docblock.description: Returns the allowed returnable fields for a given listingID.
docblock.long-description: Note: Valid ancillarykey is required in the request header.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The idxID of MLS.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The listing ID.

tag.name: return
tag.description: List of fields that are returnable for the listingID.

docblock.description: This is a simple, access anywhere, method for getting a list of all API components available.

tag.name: return
tag.description: All available APIs/Components.

docblock.description: Returns the detailed information for a given listingID.
docblock.long-description: Note: Valid ancillarykey is required in the request header.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The idxID of MLS.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The listing ID.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Array of fields to return in the output.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Include MLS disclaimer/courtesy in the response. Default true.

tag.name: return
tag.description: List of fields that are returnable for the listingID.

docblock.description: A simple method for listing all available methods in the current API component. This method will also list which request methods (GET, PUT, POST, or DELETE) are supported by each method in addition to each method status.

docblock.description: View all offices on a mutli-user account.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Query args to send in to API call.

tag.name: return
tag.description: All offices on the account or those matching filter values.

docblock.description: Returns the postalcodes available in each of a client's postalcode lists. Since a client can build any number of postalcode lists this method requires the ID of which list you want to view. To get a list of all postalcode lists available do not send the primary request ID. The default list on each account has the id combinedActiveMLS.
docblock.long-description: Note: This method was previously called as "zipcodes" but was changed to keep API format more international. Calls to "zipcodes" will be forwarded to "postalcodes" and "zipcodes" is listed as deprecated in the method list.

tag.name: param
tag.description: If no ID is given a list of IDs is returned.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Query args to send in to API call.

tag.name: return
tag.description: All postalcodes in a given list or, if no list ID is provided, a list of list IDs.

docblock.description: Returns the IDs and names for each of a client's postalcode lists including MLS postalcode lists. To get the list of all postal code lists available do not send the primary request ID. The default list on each account has the ID combinedActiveMLS

tag.name: return
tag.description: A list of city list IDs and names

docblock.description: Returns the search results for a provided saved link ID.
docblock.long-description: Note: Valid ancillarykey is required in the request header.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The ID of a client's saved link.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Query args to send in to API call.

tag.name: return
tag.description: All property results for a provided Saved Link ID.

docblock.description: Remove a new client saved link.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The ID of a client's saved link.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Nothing on success.

docblock.description: Get saved links for a given client account.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Query args to send in to API call.

tag.name: return
tag.description: All saved links on the account.

docblock.description: Update an existing client's saved link

tag.name: param
tag.description: The ID of a client's saved link.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Savedlink fields to update.

tag.name: return
tag.description: If no POST data is supplied, then a list of updatable fields with format information is returned, otherwise on success 204 is returned.

docblock.description: Create a new client saved link.
docblock.long-description:
Note: The updatable fields need to be in a URL encoded, ampersand delineated query string format. This action is not allowed if the client has more than 1000 saved links.
Data Example: $data = array( 'linkName' => 'Good_side_of_tracks', 'pageTitle' => 'Good_side_of_tracks', 'linkTitle' => 'Good_side_of_tracks', 'queryString' => array('idxID' => 'a001', 'hp' => '200000') );

tag.name: param
tag.description: Savedlink fields to create.

tag.name: return
tag.description: If a client saved link is successfully created, the new saved link's ID will be returned. If no PUT data is supplied, then a list of updatable fields with format information is returned.

docblock.description: Performs search and returns the results.
docblock.long-description: Note: Valid ancillarykey is required in the request header.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Query args to send in to API call.

tag.name: return
tag.description: All available APIs/Components.

docblock.description: Returns a basic set of information for all of the client's sold and pending properties. That is, those that have been removed from their MLS data.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Query args to send in to API call.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Sold/pending properties on the account.

docblock.description: Remove a clients supplemental property.
docblock.long-description: This method is to be used at your own risk. We will NOT be held accountable for programmatic errors in your code or the improper use of search values or options within said values resulting in deletion of supplemental properties.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The listingID of a supplmental property.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Nothing on success.

docblock.description: Returns a basic set of information for all of the client's supplemental (non-MLS) properties.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Query args to send in to API call.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Supplemental properties on the account.

docblock.description: Update an existing supplemental listing.
docblock.long-description:
Note: if updating images, existing images are deleted and the new images are inserted instead for the listing.
Data Example: $data = array( 'likeIdxID' => 'a001', 'likeMlsPtID' => '1', 'images' => array('http://example.com/image1.jpg', 'http://example.com/image2.jpg') );

tag.name: param
tag.description: The supplemental listing ID.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Supplemental fields to update.

tag.name: return
tag.description: If no POST data is supplied, then a list of updatable fields with format information is returned, otherwise on success 204 is returned.

docblock.description: Create a new supplemental listing.
docblock.long-description:
Note: likeIdxID and likeMlsPtID fields are required.
Data Example: $data = array( 'likeIdxID' => 'a001', 'likeMlsPtID' => '1', 'images' => array('http://example.com/image1.jpg', 'http://example.com/image2.jpg') );

tag.name: param
tag.description: Supplemental fields to create.

tag.name: return
tag.description: If a supplemental listing is successfully created, the new supplemental listing ID will be returned. If no PUT data is supplied, then a list of updatable fields with format information is returned.

docblock.description: Gathers all the pages system pages (search, featured, contact, etc) that can be directly linked to without additional property information being included in the URL.

tag.name: param
tag.description: String or array of fields to return in the output.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The name, unique ID, and URL for all system links on the account. Additionally there is a boolean named systemresults. If true this is a property results page that requires additional parameters. This means the url can be useful when dynamically building results page links but should not be linked to directly. When a client has more than one MLS on their account, listings for search pages that can vary by MLS ID will include a subpages array element.

docblock.description: Gather all the URLs for javascript widgets on the user's account. These widgets can then be placed on the user's main site via the included URLs.

tag.name: param
tag.description: String or array of fields to return in the output.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The name, unique ID and URL for all javascript widgets that have been created on the user's account.

docblock.description: Remove a clients supplemental property.
docblock.long-description: This method is to be used at your own risk. We will NOT be held accountable for programmatic errors in your code or the improper use of search values or options within said values resulting in deletion of supplemental properties.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Nothing on success.

docblock.description: Returns the zipcodes available in each of a client's zipcode lists. Since a client can build any number of zipcode lists this method requires the ID of which list you want to view. To get a list of all zipcode lists available do not send the primary request ID. The default list on each account has the id combinedActiveMLS.

tag.name: param
tag.description: If no ID is given a list of IDs is returned.

tag.name: param
tag.description: String or array of fields to return in the output.

tag.name: return
tag.description: All zipcodes in a given list or, if no list ID is provided, a list of list IDs..

docblock.description: Gives the date and time a particular MLS was last downloaded, processed and the last time images gathering was completed.
docblock.long-description: Note: dates/times given are UTC.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Format: x000 .

tag.name: param
tag.description: String or array of fields to return in the output.

tag.name: return
tag.description: An array of timestamps for last downloaded, last processes and last images gathered.

docblock.description: This method provides all of the IDX IDs and names for all of the paperwork approved MLSs on the client's account.
docblock.long-description: Note: This method was previously camelcased as "approvedMLS" but was made lower case to fit the API naming convention. Calls to "approvedMLS" will be forwarded to "approvedmls" and "approvedMLS" is listed as deprecated in the method list.

tag.name: param
tag.description: String or array of fields to return in the output.

tag.name: return
tag.description: A list of IDs and names for all MLSs approved for display on the client account.

docblock.description: All cities represented in the current set of MLS data are available from this method. The output can be filtered using additional GET parameters.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Format: x000 .

tag.name: param
tag.description: The field to use when filtering output. Allowed values: "cityID, cityName, stateAbrv, mlsPtID".

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value by which to filter. Conditional on use of filterField.

tag.name: param
tag.description: String or array of fields to return in the output.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Available cities along with applicable city ID, property type, and state as well as a count of the number of occurrences for each value.

docblock.description: All counties represented in the current set of MLS data are available from this method. The output can be filtered using additional GET parameters.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Format: x000.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The field to use when filtering output. Allowed values: "countyID, countyName, stateAbrv, mlsPtID".

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value by which to filter. Conditional on use of filterField.

tag.name: param
tag.description: String or array of fields to return in the output.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Available counties along with applicable county ID, property type, and state as well as a count of the number of occurrences of each value.

docblock.description: This is a simple, access anywhere, method for getting a list of all API components available.

tag.name: return
tag.description: All available APIs/Components

docblock.description: A simple method for listing all available methods in the current API component. This method will also list which request methods (GET, PUT, POST, or DELETE) are supported by each method in addition to each method status.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Basic information about all available methods in this API.

docblock.description: All postal codes represented in the current set of MLS data are available from this method. The output can be filtered using additional GET parameters.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Format: x000.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The field to use when filtering output. Allowed values: "id, stateAbrv, mlsPtID".

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value by which to filter. Conditional on use of filterField.

tag.name: param
tag.description: String or array of fields to return in the output.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Available postalcodes along with applicable property type and state as well as a count of the number of occurrences of each value.

docblock.description: The sum total of properties listed in a given MLS as well as sums for each property type in the MLS.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Format: x000.

tag.name: param
tag.description: String or array of fields to return in the output.

tag.name: return
tag.description: A multidimensional array with the total sum and the sum for each property type.

docblock.description: Gives a total number of listings available for a given city, county, or zipcode.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Format: x000.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Specify if you are looking for the count of a city, county, or zipcode. Allowed values: "city", "county", "zipcode".

tag.name: param
tag.description: The numeric city ID, county ID, or zipcode for which you want to get a property count.

tag.name: return
tag.description: An integer count of the number of properties.

docblock.description: Gives the property type information for all types that are available on a given MLS.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Format: x000.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The field to use when filtering output. Allowed values: "mlsPtID, mlsPropertyType".

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value by which to filter. Conditional on use of filterField.

tag.name: param
tag.description: String or array of fields to return in the output.

tag.name: return
tag.description: An array of property type information including MLS property type ID, MLS property type name, parent property type, and subtypes.

docblock.description: All the fields in a given MLS that are currently allowed to be searched according to MLS guidelines.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Format: x000.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The field to use when filtering output. Allowed values: "mlsPtID, parentPtID".

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value by which to filter. Conditional on use of filterField.

tag.name: param
tag.description: String or array of fields to return in the output.

tag.name: return
tag.description: An array containing all MLS fields that are searchable according to MLS rules and IDX guidelines. Array contains the field's name (which is the field to be used as a key when performing a search), the display name (as should be displayed in a search form), and both the mlsPtID and parentPtID to which the field belongs.

docblock.description: Field values in a given MLS that are currently allowed to be searched according to MLS guidelines.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Format: x000.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The IDX assigned ID of the MLS property type(s). See the propertytypes method in this API/Component for a lookup of property type IDs.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Mls field name - the IDX assigned name of the MLS field name. See the searchfields for the list of searchable fields.

tag.name: return
tag.description: An array containing all the values for the given mls field.

docblock.description: All zip codes represented in the current set of MLS data are available from this method. The output can be filtered using additional GET parameters.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Format: x000.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The field to use when filtering output. Allowed values: "mlsPtID, parentPtID".

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value by which to filter. Conditional on use of filterField.

tag.name: param
tag.description: String or array of fields to return in the output.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Available zipcodes along with applicable property type and state as well as a count of the number of occurrences of each value.

docblock.description: Update leads in batches of up to 100 per request.
docblock.long-description:
Note: Each lead field should be passed as an indexed array starting at and going to, at most, 100. There must not be any gaps. LeadID is required for each lead to be updated
Data Example: $data = array( 'id[0]' = 1, 'firstName[0]' => 'John', 'lastName[0]' => 'Doe', 'email[0]' => 'john@example.com', 'id[1]' = 2, 'firstName[1]' => 'Aaron', 'lastName[1]' => 'Aaronson', 'email[1]' => 'aaron@example.com' );

tag.name: param
tag.description: Supplemental fields to update.

tag.name: return
tag.description: If a leads are successfully updated the updated lead IDs will be returned. If no POST data is supplied then a list of updatable fields with format information is returned.

docblock.description: Add leads in batches of up to 100 per request.
docblock.long-description:
Note: Each lead field should be passed as an indexed array starting at and going to, at most, 100. There must not be any gaps.
Data Example: $data = array( 'firstName[0]' => 'John', 'lastName[0]' => 'Doe', 'email[0]' => 'john@example.com', 'firstName[1]' => 'Aaron', 'lastName[1]' => 'Aaronson', 'email[1]' => 'aaron@example.com' );

tag.name: param
tag.description: Supplemental fields to update.

tag.name: return
tag.description: If a lead is successfully created the new lead IDs will be returned. If no PUT data is supplied then a list of updatable fields with format information is returned.

docblock.description: Remove a lead system wide.
docblock.long-description: This method is to be used at your own risk. We will NOT be held accountable for programmatic errors in your code or the improper use of search values or options within said values resulting in deletion of leads.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The ID of a lead.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Nothing on success.

docblock.description: Get information for one or multiple leads.

tag.name: param
tag.description: If no ID is given a list of IDs is returned.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Query args to send in to API call.

tag.name: return
tag.description: If a lead ID is provided detailed information about that lead is returned. Otherwise simple information about all leads is returned.

docblock.description: Update the information for one lead specified by the primary request ID.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The ID of a lead.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Lead fields to update.

tag.name: return
tag.description: If a leads are successfully updated the updated lead IDs will be returned. If no POST data is supplied then a list of updatable fields with format information is returned.

docblock.description: Create a new lead.
docblock.long-description:
Special Note: Currently the API cannot differentiate between a lead rejected due to server error or one rejected due to bad email address. The lead system requires email addresses that are correctly formatted to cut down on garbage accounts, and they need to have a valid MX record. Most 500 error from this method are a result of bad email addresses. In future versions we will differentiate the error and make the MX record requirement optional.
Data Example: $data = array( 'firstName' => 'John', 'lastName' => 'Doe', 'email' => 'john@example.com' );

tag.name: param
tag.description: Lead fields to create.

tag.name: return
tag.description: If a lead is successfully created the new lead's ID will be returned. If no PUT data is supplied then a list of updatable fields with format information is returned.

docblock.description: Get traffic history for a specified lead.
docblock.long-description: For bandwidth and memory considerations there is a limit of 5,000 on the number of lead traffics that can be returned in any single request.

tag.name: param
tag.description: If no ID is given a list of IDs is returned.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Query args to send in to API call.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The applicable client account ID, date, lead ID, IP , page, and referrer.

docblock.description: This is a simple, access anywhere, method for getting a list of all API components available.

tag.name: return
tag.description: All available APIs/Components.

docblock.description: This is a simple, access anywhere, method for getting a list of all API components available.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The ID of the note to delete.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Query args to send in to API call.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Lead note information. If no note ID is sent all notes for the lead are returned. If a note ID is passed only the one note is returned.

tag.description: An array with 2 keys. The key searchInformation that contains all existing saved search information. The key info will return messages about any returned saved search. Currently this info will tell you if any search's advanced fields are not valid in the IDX system.
